channel.title: My 1-Shot FM Idea
channel.description:
FM 1-Shots
17 Players
Town Reloader Town Reloader 11 Town 1-Shots
Mafia Reloader 3 Mafia 1-Shots
There are a total of 25 1-Shots in this Setup!
1-Shot Poisoner 1-Shot Expert Doctor 1-Shot Paranoid Gun Owner 1-Shot Commuter 1-Shot Vigilante 1-Shot Roleblocker 1-Shot Alignment Cop 1-Shot Rolestopper 1-Shot Day Role Cop 1-Shot Watcher 1-Shot Tracker 1-Shot Gladiator 1-Shot Gravekeeper 1-Shot Bus Driver 1-Shot Redirector 1-Shot Jailkeeper 1-Shot Bulletproof 1-Shot Lie Detector 1-Shot Arsonist 1-Shot Babysitter 1-Shot Huntsman 1-Shot Vanillalizer 1-Shot Day Vigilante 1-Shot Scout 1-Shot Gun Dealer
Extra Information:
Arsonist doesn’t need any shots to ignite.
Each Mafia 1-Shot May Choose to Re-roll their role. They can only do this each once per game.
Mafia cannot have a duplicate of the same role.
Day Vigilante Must publicly shoot someone.
The Gun Dealer Roles Ability is During the night you choose a player and that player receives a gun to shoot publicly the following day and just shoot it the following day or loses the gun.
The Expert Doctor has the abilities of both the Doctor, Firefighter and Poison/Day Doctor.
Roleblocker can choose to Roleblock during the day or the night but not both with the 1 Shot.
Bulletproof can also be used during the day to stop Day Kills such as Poison or a Vigilante Shot.
The Scout
If your target attacks someone the attacked player will receive night immunity for that night and if your target was attacked the attacker will be roleblocked the following night.
Reloader’s Give their target an extra 1-Shot.
(Please give Feedback)

item.title: My 1-Shot FM Idea

item.description:

1-Shot Gravekeeper

Read full topic

item.title: My 1-Shot FM Idea
item.dc:creator: KyoDaz
item.description:
I’m not a reviewer but here is my advice if I wanted to really host this setup for some reason
Gaining an entirely useless 1-shot is also not fun and incredibly swingy in itself so I’d start by removing them. Remove stuff like this

ChopChop:

1-Shot Alignment Cop

You could in theory make scum never manage to get alignment cop ect.
But that’s harder to balance than just outright having no PR that is entirely useless to one side and AI cops suck anyway

My second recommendation would be to balance the impact chance of the PRs
I personally make a mental note in my head the impact of what PRs can do in terms of overall performance
ect. Watcher = 4/5 for Town, Poisoner = 2/5 for Town
This will be harder to do because both sides can roll the same PRs
So a Poisoner could be a 3/5 for scum but 2/5 for town ect.

ChopChop:

Mafia cannot have a duplicate of the same role.

This will inevitably lead to mechanical deduction through things like confirmable PRs

‘My ability was removed from me, both KyoDaz & Gaga are confirmed vanillaizer, therefore they can’t be on the same mafia team!’

ect.

Unfortunately this can’t be remedied by ‘oh just make PRs unique’ because then this is an open setup with duplicate claim mechanical deduction
Which is worse than confirmable mechanical PRs

But just balancing the overall PR power seems relatively difficult considering they can both roll it but it’s definitely possible
This was one of the things I ran into with WoW:BfA, because both sides can roll the same classes
Sub-classes made this a bit easier to balance
But outright one-shots with no other alternative is why I’d recommend designing something else
You can take this if you find it useful and try to design it if you’re incredibly passionate about it but I’d just suggest looking at something else to design

Read full topic

item.title: My 1-Shot FM Idea
item.dc:creator: Wazza
item.description:
just call it bastard so you don’t have to bother with balance and instead focus on ‘fun’

Read full topic

item.title: My 1-Shot FM Idea
item.dc:creator: Whysper
item.description:
What I’ve seen done in some games is to group the roles by power level, then rand within a grouping. So like if there are 3 power levels A, B, and C (A the strongest), then rand 1 within A, 2 within B, and the rest within C as just an example. If there are certain combinations that are OP, then maybe specifically prevent those (like if x is randed from A, then don’t allow y from B).

Read full topic

item.title: My 1-Shot FM Idea
item.dc:creator: Marshal
item.description:
I mean it’d probably have to have a power level more similar to matrix setups to be considered really “balanced”

so like

gut a lot of the roles and replace it with VTs

you can say “VTs are boring” but like is it realistically more fun to be like a tracker vs. a vt.

rolemadness games are never really going to be “balanced”

fun is another question

Read full topic

item.title: My 1-Shot FM Idea
item.dc:creator: TrustworthyLiberal
item.description:
I do feel this in general is a super town sided setup as most of the PRs stand to help town way more the mafia.

Also the fact a mafia reloader and mafia 1-shot big actually doesn’t break the game enough in mafias favor shots this fact.

Game would be D1 Mass claim and Lie Detector as a day cop if randed.
